# Discord Chat Analysis for ðŸ’»â”‚developers

## 1. Summary
The discussion primarily focused on technical aspects of 3D rendering and development in Hyperfy. Key topics included:

Emission and lighting techniques were extensively discussed, with users sharing workarounds for color emission issues by using texture atlases and proper material setup. Vox detailed an innovative lighting technique using transparent stencil meshes with cutouts above scene lights to create focused lighting effects without performance overhead.

Skybox implementation was addressed, with Ashxn explaining that future plans involve starting worlds with a removable sky app rather than a default skysphere. Vox discussed combining multiple functionalities into a single app/hyp file for more efficient world building.

Performance optimization techniques were shared, particularly around texture reuse and draw call reduction. Vox emphasized using Blender for world building to reuse textures across different meshes, reducing bandwidth usage and improving performance.

Peezy revealed development of a UI for managing hypkg mods with a system that loads components from separate folders to prevent conflicts between mods, distinguishing between standard mods and "overhauls" that modify core functionality.

## 2. FAQ
Q: Is there a way to change the color of the emission? (asked by Gert-Jan Akerboom) A: Add a texture in the emission slot and use texture atlas; in Blender use the same color for diffuse and emissive to maintain color consistency in bloom effects. (answered by á²¼~/^b0gie-(.*)$/ and Ashxn)
Q: How can I get rid of any default skybox image that is built in core? (asked by vox) A: The plan is to have no default skysphere and worlds start with a sky app that you can delete, but still recommended to use solarpanel or other sky app since the skysphere follows the player. (answered by Ashxn)
Q: Do you guys get random disconnects in your servers? (with the voice chat staying live) (asked by vincentskele) A: Yes quite often. (answered by vox)

# Discord Chat Analysis: ðŸ§Šâ”‚3d-design

## 1. Summary:
The chat primarily focused on technical discussions about Level of Detail (LOD) implementations in 3D design. Ashxn introduced a new scale-aware LOD option that addresses the issue where fixed distance thresholds (e.g., 5 meters) for LOD transitions don't work well when objects are scaled. The new feature automatically adjusts LOD transition distances proportionally when objects are scaled, maintaining appropriate visual quality. There was also a brief discussion about vertex painting, with b0gie mentioning its applications for "filler objects" in worlds, noting that higher vertex counts enable better color blending, and mentioning UCUPaint for emissive painting. A question about LOD implementation and drawcalls was also addressed, confirming that using multiple LODs does increase drawcalls but typically results in better overall performance.

## 2. FAQ:
Q: If I instance many different items across the scene, each with 3 LODs that I see at different stages simultaneously, do I get 3 times the drawcalls compared to using just 1 LOD? (asked by vox) A: Yes, but in most cases you're still far better off [performance-wise]. (answered by Ashxn)
